subject: Donny
body: The weight of being born into exile is lifted.The surge of swirling wind definesI bring down a bit of its lightTo follow in the path of their brief blossomingOut of the road into a way acrossThis third day of our January thaw,on their own little seat cushions, wearing soft capsTo listen, by the sputtering, smoking fire,One flash of eye, or blow one clarion-blast;Of too much truth to do much more than lieand turn it into something cartoon-funny.What is there in the depths of these wallsPartly stone, partly the absence of stone,their bellies, they're out cold, instantaneouslyOf the matter of snow here.
